title: XSS - URL Redirects

profile.name: Shopify
profile.about: Shopify is a multi-channel commerce platform that helps people sell online, in-store, and everywhere in between.

vulnerability_information:
Hi!
I found that https://[shop name].myshopify.com/admin/redirects is vulnerable to XSS
To Reproduce:

1. Click Add Url Redirect
2. set page for redirect
3. add redirects as: 
javascript:alert(document.domain)
or data:text/html;base64,PHNjcmlwdD5hbGVydCgiY29va2llIHN0ZWFsOiAiK2RvY3VtZW50LmNvb2tpZSk7d2luZG93LmxvY2F0aW9uLmhyZWY9J2h0dHA6Ly93d3cuZ29vZ2xlLmNvbSc7PC9zY3JpcHQ+
(XSS and URL redirect)
4. A new redirect link created
5. Click on link
6. XSS

Thanks
Fr33d0m from vlazeg team
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi!
I found that https://[shop name].myshopify.com/admin/redirects is vulnerable to XSS
To Reproduce:

  1. Click Add Url Redirect
  2. set page for redirect
  3. add redirects as: javascript:alert(document.domain) or data:text/html;base64,PHNjcmlwdD5hbGVydCgiY29va2llIHN0ZWFsOiAiK2RvY3VtZW50LmNvb2tpZSk7d2luZG93LmxvY2F0aW9uLmhyZWY9J2h0dHA6Ly93d3cuZ29vZ2xlLmNvbSc7PC9zY3JpcHQ+ (XSS and URL redirect)
  4. A new redirect link created
  5. Click on link
  6. XSS

Thanks
Fr33d0m from vlazeg team

activities.message:
Open redirect and XSS (useful for phishing) with data Url  poc (working on Firefox - latest) 
http://javascript-alert-0d-0a.myshopify.com/xss3

(password: pocvlazeg)

activities.message:
The issue that you describe in your report is listed on our [program page](https://hackerone.com/shopify) under **Known issues or previously reported vulnerabilities**:

>  Execution of arbitrary scripts in your own store - Shopify gives merchants complete control over their store front so they can customize it and make it their own. For this reason, we allow javascript to be included throughout the store by store administrators. This means we will reject any submission where the issue being reported requires a store administrator privilege to trigger. We are only interested in XSS vulnerabilities that can be triggered by unauthorized users.

Please make sure you read the program page before submitting vulnerabilities.
activities.markdown_message:
The issue that you describe in your report is listed on our program page under Known issues or previously reported vulnerabilities:

Execution of arbitrary scripts in your own store - Shopify gives merchants complete control over their store front so they can customize it and make it their own. For this reason, we allow javascript to be included throughout the store by store administrators. This means we will reject any submission where the issue being reported requires a store administrator privilege to trigger. We are only interested in XSS vulnerabilities that can be triggered by unauthorized users.

Please make sure you read the program page before submitting vulnerabilities.

activities.message: And of course if you mean that only admin can set the payload, just to remember you that a limited employee with only Navigation admin access can set an XSS for account owner (like 56305 bug)
activities.markdown_message: And of course if you mean that only admin can set the payload, just to remember you that a limited employee with only Navigation admin access can set an XSS for account owner (like 56305 bug)

activities.message:
As stated on our program page:

> This means we will reject any submission where the issue being reported requires a store administrator privilege to trigger.

If they have access to the `/admin` section, then they are a "store administrator".
activities.markdown_message:

activities.message:
Just to remember you, your comment on bug 56305:
"Thank you for reporting this issue.
It's a valid bug but we already have mitigation in place for it."

So? Two different comments for same issue (limited admin staff attacking store owner)...

And last but not least fix this: "For this reason, we allow javascript to be included throughout the store by store administrators." to "For this reason, we allow javascript to be included throughout the store or the admin panel by store administrators."

Cheers
Fr33d0m

activities.message: I'm sorry, we will not  make invalid issues public unless they are relevant for other researchers. This issue is listed in **Known issues or previously reported vulnerabilities**, and clearly not in the scope of our bug bounty, so making it public is not relevant.
activities.markdown_message: I'm sorry, we will not make invalid issues public unless they are relevant for other researchers. This issue is listed in Known issues or previously reported vulnerabilities, and clearly not in the scope of our bug bounty, so making it public is not relevant.

activities.message: Thats unfair.... you have been reward anyone with a XSS vulnerability in /admin page (example: https://hackerone.com/reports/62427), except me!!
